title.narrative: Protecting Mothers and Children by Ending Family Detention

description.narrative:
Objective 1: Produce a video short to be used in an online funding campaign
? Activity 1a: Contract with an experienced video production studio; ? Activity 1b: Complete production within 3 months of funding; ? Activity 1c: Coordinate a social media campaign to accompany the video short.
Outcome of Objective 1: Raise $100,000 for legal services and “freedom bonds” for mothers and children in immigration detention.
Objective 2: Provide legal screenings to mothers and children detained by the U.S. immigration authorities in Karnes and Dilley, TX.
? Activity 2a: RAICES attorneys provide consultations at Karnes and Dilley ? Activity 2b: RAICES attorneys provide pro bono matching and mentoring ? Activity 2c: Mothers and children receive legal consultations prior to their Credible Fear Interviews with the U.S. Asylum Office.
Outcome of Objective 2: Provide consultations to 40 mothers prior to their Credible Fear Interview
Objective 3: Provide representation to mothers and children asking an immigration judge to set a bond amount that can be paid in exchange for the freedom of the mother and child.
? Activity 3a: RAICES attorneys provide direct representation and pro bono matching and mentoring ? Activity 3b: Engage with attorneys nationwide who can represent mothers and children telephonically ? Activity 3c: Establish a volunteer network of individuals who can help to prepare applications for bond hearings and letters of support from the U.S. resident families of the detained mothers and children.
Outcome of Objective 3: Provide pro bono representation to 15 mothers in bond hearings
Objective 4: Engage with private bar attorneys to provide pro bono representation to mothers and children who bond out of detention and resettle outside of RAICES’ service area.
? Activity 4a: Conduct outreach with the organized private bar, such as the Association of Pro Bono Counsel (APBCo); ? Activity 4b: Identify individuals in detention who will be released to live in the city where a pro bono partner resides; ? Activity 4c: Match mothers and children who have been released from detention with pro bono counsel in the city to which they have resettled.
Outcome of Objective 4: Match 10 mothers with pro bono attorneys.
